00043 #ifndef INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB
00044 # define INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB 1
00045 #endif
00046 #if (INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB == 0)
00047 # if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00048 #  include <emmintrin.h>
00049 # elif defined(__GNU_COMPILER)
00050 #  if (__GCC_VERSION >= 40500)
00051 #   warning "Use of the GCC 4.5+ libraries for half-precision floats is untested, \
00052              recommend building with INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB=0 for now."
00053      // Note that GCC must include the "-mfp16-format=ieee" option to select the
00054      // IEEE 754-2008 version of half-precision (rather than an out-dated ARM
00055      // format that is similar but omits NaN and +/-Inf). When this option is
00056      // set the "__fp16" data type becomes available for storage and conversion
00057      // to/from "float".
00058 #  else
00059 #   error "GNU C++ does not provide compiler-specific FLOAT16 libraries prior to \
00060            version 4.5, try re-building with INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB=0"
00061 #  endif
00062 # else
00063 #  error "Could not find compiler-specific FLOAT16 libraries, try re-building \
00064           with INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB=0"
00065 # endif
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 
00069 #if defined(__GNUC__) && !(defined(__APPLE__) && defined(__MACH__))
00070 // GCC 4.1.2 provides low-level implementations of __bswap_16/__bswap_32/__bswap_64
00071 // via byteswap.h, however these are not present under OS X (__APPLE__ & __MACH__)
00072 // so we omit the include file there and just use the definitions appearing below.
00073 // Note that it is possible these are missing under BSD too, but this is untested.
00074 # include <byteswap.h>
00075 #else
00076 
00077 #ifndef __bswap_16
00078 inline uint16_t __bswap_16 (uint16_t val) {
00079   return ((val & 0xff00) >> 8)
00080        | ((val & 0x00ff) << 8);
00081 }
00082 inline int16_t __bswap_16 (int16_t val) {
00083   uint16_t v = __bswap_16(*((uint16_t*)&val));
00084   return *((int16_t*)&v);
00085 }
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 #ifndef __bswap_32
00089 # if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00090 #  define __bswap_32(val) bswap(val)
00091 # else
00092 inline uint32_t __bswap_32 (uint32_t val) {
00093   return ((val & 0xff000000) >> 24)
00094        | ((val & 0x00ff0000) >>  8)
00095        | ((val & 0x0000ff00) <<  8)
00096        | ((val & 0x000000ff) << 24);
00097 }
00098 inline int32_t __bswap_32 (int32_t val) {
00099   uint32_t v = __bswap_32(*((uint32_t*)&val));
00100   return *((int32_t*)&v);
00101 }
00102 inline float __bswap_32 (float val) {
00103   uint32_t v = __bswap_32(*((uint32_t*)&val));
00104   return *((float*)&v);
00105 }
00106 # endif
00107 #endif
00108 
00109 #ifndef __bswap_64
00110 # if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00111 #  define __bswap_64(val) bswap64(val)
00112 # else
00113 inline uint64_t __bswap_64 (uint64_t val) {
00114   return ((val & __UINT64_C(0xff00000000000000)) >> 56)
00115        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x00ff000000000000)) >> 40)
00116        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x0000ff0000000000)) >> 24)
00117        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x000000ff00000000)) >>  8)
00118        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x00000000ff000000)) <<  8)
00119        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x0000000000ff0000)) << 24)
00120        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x000000000000ff00)) << 40)
00121        | ((val & __UINT64_C(0x00000000000000ff)) << 56);
00122 }
00123 inline int64_t __bswap_64 (int64_t val) {
00124   uint64_t v = __bswap_64(*((uint64_t*)&val));
00125   return *((int64_t*)&v);
00126 }
00127 inline double __bswap_64 (double val) {
00128   uint64_t v = __bswap_64(*((uint64_t*)&val));
00129   return *((double*)&v);
00130 }
00131 # endif
00132 #endif
00133 #endif
00134 
00135 // Avoid warnings caused by the __bswap_XX(..) functions being unsigned-only on some platforms
00136 _Clang_Pragma("clang diagnostic push")
00137 _Clang_Pragma("clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wsign-compare\"")

00299     template <bool, typename T>
00300     struct type_requirement;
00301 
00302     template <typename T>
00303     struct type_requirement<true, T>
00304     {
00305       typedef T type;
00306     };
00307 
00314     template <typename T1, typename T2>
00315     T2 safecastT1ToT2 (T1 val) {
00316       typename type_requirement<sizeof(T1)==sizeof(T2), T2>::type ret;
00317       memcpy(&ret, &val, sizeof(ret));
00318       return ret;
00319     };
00320 
00328     inline int64_t doubleToRawLongBits (double val) {
00329       return safecastT1ToT2<double,int64_t>(val);
00330     }
00331 
00339     inline int32_t floatToRawIntBits (float val) {
00340       return safecastT1ToT2<float,int32_t>(val);
00341     }

00350     inline double longBitsToDouble (int64_t bits) {
00351       return safecastT1ToT2<int64_t,double>(bits);
00352     }

00361     inline float intBitsToFloat (int32_t bits) {
00362       return safecastT1ToT2<int32_t,float>(bits);
00363     }

00365     // We have checked and the compiler (GCC 4.4.5 with -O3), when in-lining any
00366     // calls in the pack/unpack methods will optimize out the "if (rep == BYTE_ORDER) {"
00367     // branch in situations where the byte order is already indicated to be a
00368     // compile-time constant (i.e. explicitly BIG_ENDIAN or LITTLE_ENDIAN).

00371     // IEEE 754-2008
00373 
00382     int16_t _toHalfInternal (float val);
00383 
00406     inline int16_t toHalf (float val) {
00407 #if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && (INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB == 0)
00408       return (int16_t)_cvtss_sh(val, 0); // 0 = IMM8 value with no overrides set
00409 #elif defined(__GNU_COMPILER) && (INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB == 0)
00410       __fp16 value = val;  // <-- __fp16 is defined data type in GCC
00411       return *((int16_t*)(void*)&value);
00412 #else
00413       return _toHalfInternal(val);
00414 #endif
00415     }
00416 
00425     float _fromHalfInternal (int16_t bits);
00426 
00449     inline float fromHalf (int16_t bits) {
00450 #if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && (INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB == 0)
00451       // The docs say to use the following call, but all of the versions of
00452       // <emmintrin.h> that I've seen omit the 'imm' argument.
00453       // return _cvtsh_ss((uint16_t)bits, 0); // 0 = IMM8 value with no overrides set
00454       return _cvtsh_ss((uint16_t)bits);
00455 #elif defined(__GNU_COMPILER) && (INTERNAL_FLOAT16_LIB == 0)
00456       __fp16 value = *((__fp16*)(void*)&bits);  // <-- __fp16 is defined data type in GCC
00457       return (float)value;
00458 #else
00459       return _fromHalfInternal(bits);
00460 #endif
00461     }

00464     // 64-BIT
00466 
00471     inline double toDouble64 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t bits) {
00472       double divisor = (double)(__INT64_C(0x1) << radixPoint);
00473       return bits / divisor;
00474     }
00475 
00481     inline int64_t fromDouble64 (int32_t radixPoint, double val) {
00482       double divisor = (double)(__INT64_C(0x1) << radixPoint);
00483       double bitVal  = rint(val * divisor);
00484       if (bitVal > numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()) return __INT64_C(0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF);
00485       if (bitVal < numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) return __INT64_C(0x8000000000000000);
00486       return (int64_t)bitVal;
00487     }
00488 
00494     inline float toFloat64 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t bits) {
00495       return (float)toDouble64(radixPoint, bits);
00496     }
00497 
00503     inline int64_t fromFloat64 (int32_t radixPoint, float val) {
00504       return fromDouble64(radixPoint, val);
00505     }
00506 
00512     inline int64_t toLong64 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t bits) {
00513       // We use the double-negative trick to make rounding work for negative values;
00514       // however, in the rare case that bits=MIN_VALUE we can't do this, but that's
00515       // OK since such a value doesn't need to be rounded.
00516       return ((bits < 0) && (bits != numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()))? -(-bits >> radixPoint) : (bits >> radixPoint);
00517     }
00518 
00524     inline int64_t fromLong64 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t val) {
00525       if (val > (numeric_limits<int64_t>::max() >> radixPoint)) return __INT64_C(0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF);
00526       if (val < (numeric_limits<int64_t>::min() >> radixPoint)) return __INT64_C(0x8000000000000000);
00527       return (val << radixPoint);
00528     }
00529 
00535     inline int32_t toInt64 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t bits) {
00536       return (int32_t)toLong64(radixPoint, bits);
00537     }
00538 
00544     inline int64_t fromInt64 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t val) {
00545       return fromLong64(radixPoint, (int64_t)val);
00546     }

00557     inline double toDouble32 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t bits) {
00558       double divisor = (double)(__INT64_C(0x1) << radixPoint);
00559       return bits / divisor;
00560     }
00561 
00567     inline int32_t fromDouble32 (int32_t radixPoint, double val) {
00568       double divisor = (double)(__INT64_C(0x1) << radixPoint);
00569       double bitVal  = rint(val * divisor);
00570       if (bitVal > numeric_limits<int32_t>::max()) return 0x7FFFFFFF;
00571       if (bitVal < numeric_limits<int32_t>::min()) return 0x80000000;
00572       return (int32_t)bitVal;
00573     }
00574 
00580     inline float toFloat32 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t bits) {
00581       return (float)toDouble32(radixPoint, bits);
00582     }

00589     inline int32_t fromFloat32 (int32_t radixPoint, float val) {
00590       return fromDouble32(radixPoint, val);
00591     }

00598     inline int32_t toInt32 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t bits) {
00599       // We use the double-negative trick to make rounding work for negative values;
00600       // however, in the rare case that bits=MIN_VALUE we can't do this, but that's
00601       // OK since such a value doesn't need to be rounded.
00602       return ((bits < 0) && (bits != numeric_limits<int32_t>::min()))? -(-bits >> radixPoint) : (bits >> radixPoint);
00603     }
00604 
00610     inline int32_t fromInt32 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t val) {
00611       if (val > (numeric_limits<int32_t>::max() >> radixPoint)) return 0x7FFFFFFF;
00612       if (val < (numeric_limits<int32_t>::min() >> radixPoint)) return 0x80000000;
00613       return (val << radixPoint);
00614     }
00615 
00621     inline int64_t toLong32 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t bits) {
00622       return toInt32(radixPoint, bits);
00623     }
00624 
00630     inline int32_t fromLong32 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t val) {
00631       if (val > (numeric_limits<int32_t>::max() >> radixPoint)) return 0x7FFFFFFF;
00632       if (val < (numeric_limits<int32_t>::min() >> radixPoint)) return 0x80000000;
00633       return (int32_t)(val << radixPoint);
00634     }

00637     // 16-BIT
00639 
00644     inline double toDouble16 (int32_t radixPoint, int16_t bits) {
00645       double divisor = (double)(__INT64_C(0x1) << radixPoint);
00646       return bits / divisor;
00647     }
00648 
00654     inline int16_t fromDouble16 (int32_t radixPoint, double val) {
00655       double divisor = (double)(__INT64_C(0x1) << radixPoint);
00656       double bitVal  = rint(val * divisor);
00657       if (bitVal > numeric_limits<int16_t>::max()) return (int16_t)0x7FFF;
00658       if (bitVal < numeric_limits<int16_t>::min()) return (int16_t)0x8000;
00659       return (int16_t)bitVal;
00660     }
00661 
00667     inline float toFloat16 (int32_t radixPoint, int16_t bits) {
00668       return (float)toDouble16(radixPoint, bits);
00669     }
00670 
00676     inline int16_t fromFloat16 (int32_t radixPoint, float val) {
00677       return fromDouble16(radixPoint, val);
00678     }
00679 
00685     inline int32_t toInt16 (int32_t radixPoint, int16_t bits) {
00686       // Unlike the 32-/64-bit versions, we can avoid the strange bits=MIN_VALUE
00687       // case by just doing 32-bit math (which is what the host system prefers
00688       // anyhow).
00689       int32_t _bits = bits;
00690       return (_bits < 0)? -(-_bits >> radixPoint) : (_bits >> radixPoint);
00691     }
00692 
00698     inline int16_t fromInt16 (int32_t radixPoint, int32_t val) {
00699       if (val > (numeric_limits<int16_t>::max() >> radixPoint)) return (int16_t)0x7FFF;
00700       if (val < (numeric_limits<int16_t>::min() >> radixPoint)) return (int16_t)0x8000;
00701       return (int16_t)(val << radixPoint);
00702     }
00703 
00709     inline int64_t toLong16 (int32_t radixPoint, int16_t bits) {
00710       return toInt16(radixPoint, bits);
00711     }
00712 
00718     inline int16_t fromLong16 (int32_t radixPoint, int64_t val) {
00719       if (val > (numeric_limits<int16_t>::max() >> radixPoint)) return (int16_t)0x7FFF;
00720       if (val < (numeric_limits<int16_t>::min() >> radixPoint)) return (int16_t)0x8000;
00721       return (int16_t)(val << radixPoint);
00722     }

00747     inline char unpackByte (const void *ptr, int32_t off) {

00767     inline int16_t unpackShort (const void *ptr, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00768       const char *buf = (const char*)ptr;
00769       return (rep == BYTE_ORDER)? *((int16_t*)&buf[off])
00770                      : (int16_t)__bswap_16(*((int16_t*)&buf[off]));
00771     }
00772 
00779     inline int16_t unpackShort (const vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00780       return unpackShort(&buf[0], off, rep);
00781     }
00782 
00789     inline int32_t unpackInt24 (const void *ptr, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00790       const char *buf = (const char*)ptr;
00791       int32_t val = (rep==BIG_ENDIAN)?
00792                       ((int32_t)buf[off+2]&0xFF) | (((int32_t)buf[off+1]&0xFF)<<8) | (((int32_t)buf[off+0]&0xFF)<<16):
00793                       ((int32_t)buf[off+0]&0xFF) | (((int32_t)buf[off+1]&0xFF)<<8) | (((int32_t)buf[off+2]&0xFF)<<16);
00794       return ((val << 8) >> 8); // sign-extend
00795     }
00796 
00803     inline int32_t unpackInt24 (const vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00804       return unpackInt24(&buf[0], off, rep);
00805     }
00806

00962     inline float unpackFloat (const void *ptr, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00963       const char *buf = (const char*)ptr;
00964       if (rep == BYTE_ORDER) {
00965         return *((float*)&buf[off]);
00966       }
00967       else {
00968         uint32_t val = __bswap_32(*(uint32_t*)&buf[off]);
00969         void* v = &val;
00970         return *(float*)v;
00971       }
00972     }
00973 
00980     inline float unpackFloat (const vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00981       return unpackFloat(&buf[0], off, rep);
00982     }
00983 
00990     inline double unpackDouble (const void *ptr, int32_t off, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
00991       const char *buf = (const char*)ptr;
00992       if (rep == BYTE_ORDER) {
00993         return *((double*)&buf[off]);
00994       }
00995       else {
00996         uint64_t val = __bswap_64(*(uint64_t*)&buf[off]);
00997         void* v = &val;
00998         return *(double*)v;
00999       }
01000     }

01124       return unpackUTF8(&buf[0], off, len, replacement);
01125     }

01133     inline vector<char> unpackBytes (const vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, int32_t len) {
01134       vector<char> buffer(len);
01135       memcpy(&buffer[0], &buf[off], len);
01136       return buffer;
01137     }
01138 
01146     inline void *unpackBytes (const vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, void *buffer, int32_t len) {
01147       memcpy(buffer, &buf[off], len);
01148       return buffer;
01149     }

01164       char *buf = (char*)ptr;
01165       buf[off] = val;

01183     inline void packShort (void *ptr, int32_t off, int16_t val, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
01184       char *buf = (char*)ptr;
01185       *((int16_t*)(&buf[off])) = (rep == BYTE_ORDER)? val : (int16_t)__bswap_16(val);
01186     }
01187

01196     }

01205     inline void packInt24 (void *ptr, int32_t off, int32_t val, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
01206       char *buf = (char*)ptr;
01207       if (rep==BIG_ENDIAN) {
01208         buf[off+2] = (char)(val);
01209         buf[off+1] = (char)(val>>8);
01210         buf[off+0] = (char)(val>>16);
01211       } else {
01212         buf[off+0] = (char)(val);
01213         buf[off+1] = (char)(val>>8);
01214         buf[off+2] = (char)(val>>16);
01215       }
01216     }
01217 
01225     inline void packInt24 (vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, int32_t val, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
01226       packInt24(&buf[0], off, val, rep);
01227     }

01381     inline void packFloat (void *ptr, int32_t off, float val, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
01382       char *buf = (char*)ptr;
01383       if (rep == BYTE_ORDER) {
01384         *((float*)(&buf[off])) = val;
01385       }
01386       else {
01387         void * v = &val;
01388         *((uint32_t*)(&buf[off])) = __bswap_32(*(uint32_t*)v);
01389       }
01390     }
01391 
01398     inline void packFloat (vector<char> &buf, int32_t off, float val, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
01399       packFloat(&buf[0], off, val, rep);
01400     }

01408     inline void packDouble (void *ptr, int32_t off, double val, ByteOrder rep=BIG_ENDIAN) {
01409       char *buf = (char*)ptr;
01410       if (rep == BYTE_ORDER) {
01411         *((double*)(&buf[off])) = val;
01412       }
01413       else {
01414         void * v = &val;
01415         *((uint64_t*)(&buf[off])) = __bswap_64(*(uint64_t*)v);
01416       }
01417     }

01470     inline void packBoolean (void *ptr, int32_t off, bool val) {
01471       char *buf = (char*)ptr;
01472       if (val) buf[off] = (char)+1; // true
01473       else     buf[off] = (char)-1; // false
01474     }
01475
